org.factcenter.qilin.primitives.concrete

Class Zpstar

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.factcenter.qilin.primitives.concrete.Zpstar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Group<java.math.BigInteger>, Sampler<java.math.BigInteger>, ByteEncoder<java.math.BigInteger>, StreamEncoder<java.math.BigInteger>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Zpsafe

    public class Zpstar
extends java.lang.Object
implements Group<java.math.BigInteger>, StreamEncoder<java.math.BigInteger>, ByteEncoder<java.math.BigInteger>
    Multiplicative group of integers mod p (p must be a prime)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Zpstar(java.math.BigInteger p)
      Construct the multiplicative group of integers mod p.

      java.math.BigInteger denseDecode(byte[] input)
      Returns a random integer chosen uniformly from 0 to 2^{n-1} mod p (where n is the bit length of p's two's-complement representation); when p is large enough, this is statistically close to a uniform group member.
      byte[] encode(java.math.BigInteger input)
      Encode an element of type T as a byte array.

      • orderUpperBound

        public java.math.BigInteger orderUpperBound()
        Description copied from interface: Group
        Get a bound on the order of the group. The actual order of the group MUST divide this bound (useful for choosing a random element of the group with a known discrete log)
        Specified by:
        orderUpperBound in interface Group<java.math.BigInteger>
        Returns:
        an upper bound on the order of the group

      • injectiveEncode

        public java.math.BigInteger injectiveEncode(byte[] msg,
                                            java.util.Random rand)
                                     throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Description copied from interface: Group
        Encode a message as a group element. This encoding must be injective and have an efficient decoder (see Group.injectiveDecode(Object)). The encoding may be probabilistic (in which case it will use the supplied randomness). Note that the encoding may not be bijective -- not all group elements have a valid decoding.
        Specified by:
        injectiveEncode in interface Group<java.math.BigInteger>
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to be encoded. The message will be encoded as a Group.getInjectiveEncodeMsgLength()}-byte message, if shorter it will be zero-padded at end, if longer truncated.
        Returns:
        The encoded message.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the group doesn't support the encoding operation or if the message is too long.

      • injectiveDecode

        public byte[] injectiveDecode(java.math.BigInteger encodedMsg)
                       throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Description copied from interface: Group
        Decode a message encoded using Group.injectiveEncode(byte[], Random).
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        Throws:

      • getInjectiveEncodeMsgLength

        public int getInjectiveEncodeMsgLength()
                                throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Specified by:
        getInjectiveEncodeMsgLength in interface Group<java.math.BigInteger>
        Returns:
        the length (in bytes) of a message that can be encoded using the Group.injectiveEncode(byte[], Random) method. Shorter messages will be zero-padded at the end, longer messages will be truncated.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException

      • decode

        public java.math.BigInteger decode(byte[] input)
        Description copied from interface: ByteEncoder
        Decode an element of type T from a byte array. The input must be a possible output of ByteEncoder.encode(Object). Running ByteEncoder.encode(Object) on the return value will give back the input.
        Specified by:
        decode in interface ByteEncoder<java.math.BigInteger>

      • denseDecode

        public java.math.BigInteger denseDecode(byte[] input)
        Returns a random integer chosen uniformly from 0 to 2^{n-1} mod p (where n is the bit length of p's two's-complement representation); when p is large enough, this is statistically close to a uniform group member.
        Specified by:
        denseDecode in interface ByteEncoder<java.math.BigInteger>

      • encode

        public byte[] encode(java.math.BigInteger input)
        Description copied from interface: ByteEncoder
        Encode an element of type T as a byte array. The encoding should be unique.
        Specified by:
        encode in interface ByteEncoder<java.math.BigInteger>
